feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Heavy rainfall across Brooks Range and North Slope will result in rising water levels on streams and rivers. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected Friday evening through Saturday evening from the Colville River near Umiat east to the Ivishak River. Water levels will rise significantly and may approach
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Rivers Through the Weekend... Numerous rain showers through Saturday will cause rises on rivers and streams in the Western and Central Brooks Range through the weekend. Additional rainfall of 0.75 to 1.50 inches is expected through Saturday. People in this area should remain alert for the possibility of rising water levels through the weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Saturday... Confidence is increasing that a marine layer will develop along the coast through the weekend. This could cause daytime high temperatures to be lower than areas who do not see the marine layer develop. At this time there is a greater than 90 percent chance that temperatures will warm to the upper 60s along the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Will Bring Rises to the Taiya River... As temperatures warm into the upper 70s and even low 80s on Friday, increased snow melt and glacial runoff will cause the Taiya River to rise. There still exist some uncertainty on how high the river could rise, but it is expected to remain within its banks. Looking into the weekend, there will still be warm temperatures in

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Sunday... There is a high potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Friday will be the warmest day with a greater than 80 percent chance of communities seeing greater than 75 degrees. Warmest temperatures will occur
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough

At 1232 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sully Lake, or 8 miles southwest of Onida, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 12:01PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Spink and Brown Counties. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued July 06 at 9:13PM CDT until July 07 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Matagorda Islands, Brazoria Islands, Galveston Island and Bolivar Peninsula. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands

entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Afternoon highs of 104 to 108. * WHERE...Luna and Dona Ana Counties in New Mexico and the Rio Grande Valley of Texas. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Very hot temperatures will significantly increase

entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT TO 6 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures of 104 to 107 expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest New Mexico and southwest Texas. * WHEN...From midnight Saturday night to 6 AM MDT Tuesday.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 06 at 1:58PM CDT until July 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ TO 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures 95 to 98 degrees expected. * WHERE...The Guadalupe, Delaware, Davis, and Chinati Mountains. * WHEN...From 1 PM CDT /noon MDT/ to 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chinati Mountains; Davis Mountains; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:27AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Appomattox and Buckingham Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 122 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Buckingham County, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 12:48AM EDT until July 07 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN ALBEMARLE COUNTY... At 1248 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced between 2 and 3 inches of rain in the warned area. The heavy rain has ended, but it may take some time for water runoff to work down area streams. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 11:20PM MDT until July 07 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southwestern Sioux County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until midnight MDT.
